intro: Oncoma, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has a basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Oncoma species are often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its botanical features make it an important part of the local flora in its native range.
